description.plain:
The Band Perry is a music group composed of siblings Kimberly Perry (lead vocals, guitar), Reid Perry (bass guitar, background vocals), and Neil Perry (mandolin, bouzouki, background vocals).

Their discography comprises two studio albums, four extended plays and thirteen singles, for twelve of which a music video has been filmed. The group’s two albums were released on Republic Nashville before their split with the label in 2016.

description.plain:
Written by Kimberly Perry, “If I Die Young” was released in June 2010 as the second single from the group’s self-titled debut album.

It’s gone on to become one of the emerging band’s most popular songs.  In the lyrics, Perry daydreams of an untimely death. Over the course of the song, the singer comes to the conclusion that, if she should “die young,” she would be happy with the life she’s lived, and she would hope for her loved ones to celebrate her, rather than mourn her passing.

Interestingly, in the music video, Christina comes back to life in the end, befitting to the positive and upbeat message of the song.

http://youtu.be/7NJqUN9TClM

The song is in the key of E Major.

description.plain: “Live Forever” is the lead single from The Band Perry’s third studio album, Heart+Beat. The track, produced by Dann Huff and pop heavyweight RedOne, moves the band into a more pop-influenced sound. “Live Forever” also serves as “an anchor song” for their third album, answering a creative issue raised by Kimberley Perry while the band tried out different ideas for the album’s sound: “[i]t doesn’t matter what you say if no one wants to sing along to it.”

description.plain:
Originally written by John Hartford in the 60’s, “Gentle on My Mind” won four awards at the 1968 Grammy’s – Hartford won for best Songwriter, while Glen Campbell won for best recording. Campbell’s version, released in June of 1967, received more than 5 million radio plays.  Dean Martin and Elvis Presley also covered the song.

After performing in a tribute to Glen Campbell at the 2014 Grammy’s, The Band Perry released their studio version of this song on the soundtrack to James Keach’s 2014 documentary, I’ll Be Me.

songs.lyrics:
It's knowing that your door is always open
And your path is free to walk
That makes me tend to leave my sleeping bag
Rolled up and stashed behind your couch
And it's knowing I'm not shackled
By forgotten words and bonds
And the ink stains that are dried upon some line
That keeps you on the backroads
By the rivers of my memory
That keeps you ever gentle on my mind

It's not clinging to the rocks and ivy
Planted on their columns now that bind me
Or something that somebody said
Because they thought we fit together walking
It's just knowing that the world will not be cursing
Or forgiving when I walk along some railroad track and find
That you're moving on the backroads
By the rivers of my memory
And for hours you're just gentle on my mind

Though the wheat fields and the clothes lines
And the junkyards and the highways come between us
And some other woman's cryin' to her mother
Cause she turned and I was gone
I still might run in silence tears of joy might stain my face
And the summer sun might burn me 'til I'm blind
But not to where I cannot see you walkin' on the backroads
By the rivers flowing gentle on my mind

I dip my cup of soup back from a gurglin'
Cracklin' cauldron in some train yard
My beard a roughnin' coal pile, and
A dirty hat pulled low across my face
Through cupped hands 'round the tin can
I pretend to hold you to my breast and find
That you're waiting from the backroads
By the rivers of my memories
Ever smilin' ever gentle on my mind
Gentle on my mind
You are gentle on my mind

description.plain: “Postcard from Paris” was released on March 5, 2012 as the fifth single from the Band Perry’s self-titled debut album. Initially their label had not planned to release another song from The Band Perry. According to Songfacts however, the three siblings got so many messages about this number from fans, that the record company was forced to change their minds.

body.plain: “Postcard from Paris” was released on March 5, 2012 as the fifth single from the Band Perry’s self-titled debut album. Initially their label had not planned to release another song from The Band Perry. According to Songfacts however, the three siblings got so many messages about this number from fans, that the record company was forced to change their minds.

songs.lyrics:

[Chorus]

She read your cards upside down

I'm ruined

[Verse 2]
In the evening you can catch me daydreaming

[Chorus]
Like a postcard from Paris when I've seen the real thing

She read your cards upside down
The meanest thing you ever did is come around

[Bridge]
Just when I thought things were alright
My eyes play tricks on my mind, yeah
Will I ever be satisfied 'cause all I ever seem to find is a...

[Chorus]
A postcard from Paris when I've seen the real thing
It's like finding out your diamond is from her old promise ring
A call back from your fortune teller
She read your cards upside down
The meanest thing you ever did

The meanest thing you ever did is come around

I am ruined

Now I am ruined, yeah, I'm ruined

description.plain:
“Walk Me Down the Middle” by Kimberly, Neil and Reid Perry appears on their 2010 self-titled debut album.

Kimberly Perry said the song was inspired by a true story. In their hometown of Greeneville, Tennessee was a young man Kimberly had a thing for.  He wouldn’t take Kimberly to the county fair because his girlfriend was there.

“Walk Me Down the Middle” by Kimberly, Neil and Reid Perry appears on their 2010 self-titled debut album.

Kimberly Perry said the song was inspired by a true story. In their hometown of Greeneville, Tennessee was a young man Kimberly had a thing for.  He wouldn’t take Kimberly to the county fair because his girlfriend was there.

songs.lyrics:

Still can’t find some peace

[Chorus]
When she flies out of her mind
To a beautiful place with sunny skies
She’s free when she dreams
She’s Queen Maybelline

[Bridge]

She believes there’ll come a day
When she’ll finally find her place yeah
Yeah
Yeah
Yeah

[Chorus]
When she flies out of her mind
To a beautiful place with sunny skies
She’s free when she dreams
She’s Queen Maybelline

[Outro]
Free when she dreams
She’s Queen Maybelline
Free when she dreams
She’s Queen Maybelline
Hey, yeah
Hey, yeah
